meanings.definition: The essential or vital part of something
meanings.sent1: In a plant, water is the lifeblood that keeps it healthy.
meanings.sent2: Education is the lifeblood of a thriving society.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that coffee was his lifeblood, without which he couldn't function.
meanings.sent4: Laughter seemed to be the lifeblood of their friendship, always bringing them closer.
meanings.sent5: The love for music was her lifeblood, flowing through her veins with every beat.

meanings.definition: The most important element or factor that sustains or supports something
meanings.sent1: In a small business, loyal customers are the lifeblood for success.
meanings.sent2: Trust is the lifeblood of any healthy relationship.
meanings.sent3: To a chef, spices are the lifeblood that adds flavor to their dishes.
meanings.sent4: Hope can be the lifeblood that keeps us going during tough times.
meanings.sent5: Teamwork is the lifeblood that drives a project towards completion.
